subject: Re: [junit] test case names
msgSnippet: What i need is to output the names of all test case running in the suite and display which is executing currently when i see console. I m using log4j for
messageBody:
What i need is to output the names of all test case running in the suite and display which is executing currently when i see console.
I'm using log4j for logging so i'll be logging the test method name in log4j.
I was hoping there must be some direct way juint can log it for you in log4j.

"J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@...> wrote:
>So said Jeegar Shah on 2003-07-16 --------------------
>Is there any way Junit can print out name of the test case its
>executing ?

If you need it in an emergency, I recommend this:

protected void setUp() {
System.out.println(getName());
}

If you need something more permanent, then it depends on your needs.

Do you need to see the test name during execution or in a report?
